comments:
OS : Linux 
Not must fix 
Build date:09/08 
Blocking: NO 
Language: DEU 
Bitmap Location: V:\defects\de\Initialization.jpg 
Tester Name: Ruth Nestvold 

Problem Description: When starting Eclipse from the command line in Linux with 
a corrupted project using Java Tools, an error message appears in English, "An 
internal error occurred during:" 
This string needs to be localized in the next version. 

See the attached screen shot.

When I was opening the defect, I forgot to mention that the date formate in 
the error panel also is not localized. See the information in top right-hand 
corner of the screen shot.
Could you please provide the whole stack trace?

If you could provide steps to reproduce, I could try to localize this message. I
tried some text search so far in vain.
Thanks.

This error seems to come from the message jobs_internalError in the file
org/eclipse/core/internal/runtime/messages.properties in the plugin
org.eclipse.core.runtime_3.1.0.jar.
Move to Platform/Runtime for comments.

I agree with comment #4 - the message comes from that property file. Can the
tester confirm if that message is present in the translated version of that file
being tested?

Yes, the message is translated in German:
jobs_internalError=W\u00e4hrend \"{0}\" ist ein interner Fehler aufgetreten.

I tried with German locale and I got:
W?hrend "Java-Tools werden initialisiert" ist ein interner Fehler aufgetreten.

From the .log file I get:
!MESSAGE W?hrend "Java-Tools werden initialisiert" ist ein interner Fehler
aufgetreten.
!STACK 0
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.jdt.core.JavaCore$1.run(JavaCore.java:2715)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:76)

So it looks ok.
I would close as INVALID.

The time stamp look like: 2005-08-18 17:27:39.765
Not sure this is nls'd.

I don't know what else we can do with this bug... a manual inspection found that
the message is translated, and testing here with the German catalog found the
translated message appearing correctly in the UI.  Closing.  Please reopen if
you can reproduce with the 3.1.1 release or newer.
